newsitem.title: THAILAND: Burma hails ASEAN acceptance as new member.
newsitem.headline: Burma hails ASEAN acceptance as new member.

text.p: Burma hailed an ASEAN decision on Saturday to admit it as a new member of the regional grouping in July along with Cambodia and Laos.

"Myanmar (Burma) has always placed confidence in the wisdom of the leaders of ASEAN member nations for the acceptance of Myanmar (Burma), Cambodia and Laos into the prestigious association of the region," a government spokesman told Reuters.

The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), which groups Malaysia, Thailand, the Philippines, Singapore, Indonesia, Brunei and Vietnam, made the decision to admit the new members at a foreign ministers' meeting in Kuala Lumpur.
The decision was announced by Indonesian Foreign Minister Ali Alatas, who said induction of the new members into the influential grouping will take place in Kuala Lumpur on July 24-25.

The Burmese government spokesman said: "The association's dream to become a 100 pct regional organisation will soon become a reality and we all shall harmoniously work together to develop our region with much cooperation, coordination and understanding of each other." Burma's admission as a new ASEAN member was opposed by the United States and the opposition National League for Democracy (NLD) l ed by democracy leader Aung San Suu Kyi. They said an ASEAN decision on Burma's membership should be deferred because of the ruling State Law and Order Restoration Council's (SLORC) poor human rights record and suppression of local political movements. But ASEAN rejected Washington's stand and said it was interference in the grouping internal affairs.
